For students with caring needs outside of their studies (be this caring for child or
for a family member) the Chemistry Department is committed to removing
barriers and where exceptional childcare or other caring needs may present
specific challenges — e.g. travel for a meeting or conference, and if funding for
childcare is not available in discussion with your supervisor and college, students
should approach the Head of Department for support.

As well as this it is requested that students also reach out to their college, as there
are sometimes funds available for this type of participation element of
courses/studies from the colleges and it is essential to make limited departmental
resources go further.
Durham County Council Childcare Funding Information

The MAMS Network exists for members who are mothers and expectant mothers
at the University. Membership is drawn from across the University's departments
and divisions, covering both staff and students. The network meets informally at
least once a term and keeps in touch via email updates and a Facebook page.

e Informal social events, such as bring your own lunch meet-ups where sweet
treats are provided. These are on a drop-in basis and there is no obligation to
attend every one- feel free to drop in if you can! Those who are on maternity
leave are very welcome to attend (and it is an excellent opportunity to eat
lunch with both hands as there are always willing volunteers to help with
babies!)
e Hosting invited speakers on parenting and women’s issues

e Providing peer support and advice on issues relating to returning to work
after maternity leave

e Offering the views of mothers who are staff to the University on diversity
related topics when required
e Input to the University's Athena Swan accreditation when required.

e An informal buddy pairing service should you wish to be connected with
another MAMS member
